title: Flavor
summary: Flavor, or flavour,[lower-alpha 1] is the perceptual impression of food or other substances as determined primarily by the chemical senses of the gustatory and olfactory system.[1][2] The "trigeminal senses", which detect chemical irritants in the mouth and throat, as well as temperature and texture, are also important to the overall gestalt of taste perception. The taste of food can be altered naturally or artificially.
